id.description: A system generated unique identifier for a risk.

organisation_id.description: A system generated unique identifier for the Organisation that owns and has reported the risk.

risk_title.description: A short description of the risk.
risk_title.example: There is a risk that our systems are compromised and the Ministry of Housing, Communities and Local Government (MHCLG) experiences data loss as a result of a successful cyber attack.

risk_description.description: The details of the risk that should cover - What (hypothetically) could go wrong? What could happen to cause things to go wrong? What would the outcome be if it did go wrong?
risk_description.example: There is a risk that our systems are compromised and we experiences data loss as a result of a successful cyber attack.

principal_risk_category.description: The primary categorisation of risks as defined by the department

risk_owner.description: The User that is the owner for the risk, responsible for its overall management and reporting.

risk_to_life.description: If there is a risk of avoidable deaths and/or serious injury in areas within our responsibility or stewardship, we need to record this within the risk.

current_impact_score.description: A representation of the risks impact at the point it is recorded.

current_likelihood_score.description: A representation of the risk coming to fruition, as understood at the point the is recorded.

current_total_risk_score.description: A calculated data item to indicate the severity of the risk. It is calculated by multiplying current likelihood by current impact values.

current_mitigations.description: Detail any current mitigations already in place for the risk.
current_mitigations.example: Implemented Microsoft Sentinel to act as central point for protective monitoring. Microsoft security Centre, Cloud App security are already in place.

planned_mitigations.description: Detail any planned mitigations that will be in place for the risk.
planned_mitigations.example: The environment is monitored by suppliers as part of the service level agreement. The long-term objectives are to onboard all third party/supplier logs to provide a centralised monitoring centre via Microsoft Sentinel.

target_impact_score.description: A representation of the risks impact following mitigation.

target_likelihood_score.description: A representation of the risk coming to fruition, following mitigation.

target_total_risk_score.description: A calculated data item to indicate the severity of the risk. It is calculated by multiplying target likelihood by target impact values.

proximity.description: Determine the suitable timescale of the impact of this risk.

risk_approach.description: If the target score is lower than the current score then the Risk Owner may determine that additional mitigations need to be planned and implemented to reduce the current score to the target score. This would be the 'Treat' approach. If the Risk Owner decides they are content that no further mitigations or possible or necessary, this would be the 'Tolerate' approach.

path_to_target.description: Are the planned mitigations sufficient to bring the risk within target?

date_to_target.description: Date by which risk is expected to be within target - would often expect this to be the latest date of implementation for mitigations

created_at.description: The date and time when the Risk was created.

created_by.description: The User that created the Risk entity.

updated_at.description: The date and time when the Risk entity was last updated.

updated_by.description: The User that last updated the Risk entity.

closed_at.description: The date and time when the Risk entity was closed.

closed_by.description: The User that closed the Risk entity.
